summary: This document outlines the Know Your Customer (KYC) details for Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with Deutsche Bank, including account ownership, purpose, and financial details. It highlights Epstein's financial background, his relationship with the bank, and the accounts associated with him, particularly Jeepers Inc.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the KYC document, detailing his financial background, account ownership, and relationship with Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the Relationship Manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously worked with him at JPMorgan.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as a wealthy businessman who was one of Epstein's known clients.

persons.name: Brian M. Biggar
persons.context: Brian M. Biggar is mentioned as an approving authority in the KYC process for Epstein.

persons.name: Janice Franklin
persons.context: Janice Franklin is mentioned as part of the AML compliance team that approved the KYC for Epstein.

persons.name: Gwen Hill
persons.context: Gwen Hill is noted for signing off on the compliance aspects of Epstein's KYC documentation.

connections.description: Paul Morris is the Relationship Manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously managed him at JPMorgan.
Leslie Wexner is identified as a client of Epstein's financial management services.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is the sole shareholder of Jeepers Inc, which is a private company that holds his investments.
Epstein's estimated annual income is $10 million, with investable assets between $50 million and $100 million.
The document includes details of accounts opened for Jeepers Inc, including a checking account and a money market account.
Paul Morris introduced Epstein to Deutsche Bank after previously managing him at JPMorgan.
The KYC process for Epstein was approved by multiple compliance officers, indicating a thorough review.
